definition: right in the midpoint/a bull's eye/to hit the nail on the head
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: His iron gray hair was precisely parted and in place.
sentences.chinese: 他铁灰色的头发在正当中分开，梳得整整齐齐。

sentences.english: I was lucky that despite the noon sun, the lions and the cheetahs were awake.
sentences.chinese: 虽然日正当中，很幸运地看到醒著的老虎和猎豹。

sentences.english: At midday, criminals were put to death.
sentences.chinese: 日正当中，罪犯受刑处死。

definition: middle/center/right in the middle or center/nub
